item.title: Trader Takes Bold Short Position on XRP While Bullish on Shiba Inu
item.description: Prominent crypto and forex trader Lars Kooistra has revealed a surprising contrarian strategy involving two popular cryptocurrencies, maintaining a bearish stance on XRP while simultaneously expressing bullish sentiment toward Shiba Inu. This divergent approach comes at a time when both assets have shown related price movements in recent market activity.

item.description:

item.title: Metaplanet CEO Doubles Down: 10K BTC Goal, Yield Soars 119%
item.description:
Metaplanet has stood by its plan to accumulate 10,000 BTC by year‑end, citing long‑term value creation over short‑term moves. The firm now holds 4,855 BTC worth about $430 million, has posted a 119% BTC yield and says shareholder numbers have risen sevenfold despite the stock’s recent slide.

The post Metaplanet CEO Doubles Down: 10K BTC Goal, Yield Soars 119% appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: CNBC Poll: 50% Disapprove of Elon Musk as Tesla Profit Drops 71%
item.description:
Results from the CNBC All‑America Economic Survey have shown deepening skepticism toward Elon Musk and Tesla: 50 % of Americans now view the billionaire unfavorably and 47 % hold a negative opinion of the automaker, a backdrop to Tesla’s first‑quarter profit plunge and continued stock‑market pressure

The post CNBC Poll: 50% Disapprove of Elon Musk as Tesla Profit Drops 71% appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Is Bitcoin the New Gold? 20% Surge Breaks Its Nasdaq Ties
item.description:
Bitcoin has regained safe‑haven appeal, rising 20 % alongside gold as tariff escalation and recession risk unsettle markets. Observers say the coin has moved from tech‑centric risk asset to macro hedge, lifted by expectations of U.S. rate cuts and a softer dollar.

The post Is Bitcoin the New Gold? 20% Surge Breaks Its Nasdaq Ties appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Trump Policy Shakeup Halts KuCoin $300M CFTC Settlement Talks
item.description:
KuCoin has seen its CFTC settlement pushed back after the commission, following Trump directives, shifted from regulation‑by‑enforcement to fraud‑focused cases. With Paul Atkins now heading the SEC, agency boundaries over digital assets remain unclear, leaving firms in a fluid compliance space.

The post Trump Policy Shakeup Halts KuCoin $300M CFTC Settlement Talks appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: UN Stablecoin Alert: $24B Laundering Network Fuels Global Crime Surge
item.description:
UN Stablecoin report has warned that armed militias and transnational syndicates are exploiting low‑cost power, stablecoins and encrypted apps to finance operations. Investigators say a Cambodia platform has handled $24B since 2021, with laundering services now reaching Nigeria, Namibia and Angola.

The post UN Stablecoin Alert: $24B Laundering Network Fuels Global Crime Surge appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Oregon Sues Coinbase Over Unregistered Crypto Tokens Including XRP and ADA
item.description: Oregon has brought legal action against Coinbase, charging the cryptocurrency exchange with selling and marketing unregistered digital currencies to citizens. The lawsuit may disrupt the way cryptocurrencies are treated at the state level, particularly as it expands beyond earlier federal enforcement. item.title: Google Drops Cookie Prompt in Chrome, Adds IP Protection to Incognito
item.description:
Google on Tuesday revealed that it will no longer offer a standalone prompt for third-party cookies in its Chrome browser as part of its Privacy Sandbox initiative.
"We've made the decision to maintain our current approach to offering users third-party cookie choice in Chrome, and will not be rolling out a new standalone prompt for third-party cookies," Anthony Chavez, vice president of Privacy

item.title: Australian Federal Court Dismisses ASIC Appeal, Favoring Crypto Lender Block Earner
item.description:

item.title: ING Drives Euro Stablecoin Launch as MiCA Spurs Banking Pivot
item.description:
ING has revealed work with a multi‑bank consortium on a euro stablecoin, pending board and regulatory clearance. Under MiCA, banks have sought compliant tokens to rival Société Générale and reduce reliance on dollar‑pegged coins. Approval could broaden digital settlements across Europe in 2025.

The post ING Drives Euro Stablecoin Launch as MiCA Spurs Banking Pivot appeared first on Cryptonews.
